item.title: Programming Languages Influence Network 2018 - Black Background
item.description: A network graph showing 426 programming languages connected by 670 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others like PHP, Rust and Go. The influence relation data was retrieved from Wikidata in 2018. A great gift for programmers who are into digital art. • Also buy this artwork on wall prints, apparel, phone cases, and more.

item.title: Network Graph of npm Packages Dependencies
item.description: A poster with a network graph showing the dependencies of npm packages as of July 12, 2013 with 35,000 nodes and 66,551 edges. / The graph print is available on posters and several other products on white or Rose Quartz backgrounds. A graph of top npm packages dependencies is available at: http://www.redbubble.com/people/ramiro/works/22146195 • Also buy this artwork on wall prints, apparel, stickers, and more.

item.title: Network Graph of npm Top Packages Dependencies
item.description: A poster with a network graph showing the dependencies of npm packages with at least 10 inbound links, i. e. other packages that depend on them. The graph was calculated based on data from July 12, 2013 and consists of 717 nodes and 942 edges. / The graph print is available on posters on a white background. The full graph is available at: http://www.redbubble.com/people/ramiro/works/22146099 • Also buy this artwork on wall prints, stickers, and stationery.

item.title: Network of Programming Language Influence 2014 - White Background
item.description: A network graph with more than a thousand programming languages connected by influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, Pascal, C++, Haskell or Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with little influence on others like PHP or Argh!. / The influence relation data was retrieved from Freebase in 2014. This design available on posters and other products. An awesome gift for programmers who are into digital art. • Also buy this artwork on wall prints, apparel, stickers, and more.

item.title: Google Search based Knowledge Graph of Programmers
item.description: This graph shows the connections of programmers based on searches performed on Google in March 2013. The graph consists of 561 nodes and 1311 edges. To be included a person’s search result page on Google needed to have knowledge graph information indicating the person being a programmer. / The creators of the top programming languages according to GitHub served as seed values for searches, i. e. Brendan Eich (JavaScript), Yukihiro Matsumoto (Ruby), James Gosling (Java), Guido van Rossum (Python), Stephen R. Bourne (Bourne shell), William Nelson Joy (C shell), Rasmus Lerdorf (PHP), Dennis Ritchie ©, Bjarne Stroustrup (C++), Larry Wall (Perl), and Brad Cox (Objective-C). / The graph print is available on posters and several other products on white or Rose Quartz backgrounds. • Also buy this artwork on wall prints, stickers, phone cases, and more.
